page.title: 18A Tourist Guide
page.content: The area offers a mixture of industry and beauty spots,one of which is the Scenic Drive whose seven mile length winds its way through forested slopes to give views of the Severn estuary. There are children's play area,picnic sites,barbeque areas and forest walks. The mountains around Crosskeys not only enclose the traditional spirit of the valleys - the terraced houses,the pits and the dialect _ but also give scope for hill walking,easy or fairly strenuous.A relatively new attraction in the area is the 13 mile trek over the Islwyn mountains. Although there are villages,the area is predominantly rural.Bus services are frequent and convenient but for the tourist who is interested more in the landscape,a car is advisable.Even then one must be prepared to walk - usuallly uphill-to see the best sights
